website_summaries.verdict: Good value for a reliable claw hammer.
pros: A good hammer for smaller jobs around the house
Head attached well to handle for better durability

customer_reviews.title: Handle is Too Small and Slippery
customer_reviews.text: The handle is too small for a man's hands or a women with large hands. This makes it difficult to control the head while creating an awkward balance. It would be fine for light duty like hanging pictures and the quality is good as expected from Stanley. For a finishing hammer there are better choices like the Vaughan 7 oz. that has a normal size handle offering better control and balance. I ordered the Vaughan from Home Depot for only $7.98 to replace the Stanley.
customer_reviews.author: Brit Fam

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a great hammer to have around the house. It's great quality. I purchased this when I was a single woman living on my own and needed a hammer to do simple tasks around the home. This works great for that purpose!
customer_reviews.author: Tasha

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size and weight for a go to hammer for regular jobs around the house!
customer_reviews.author: Ladet

customer_reviews.title: GOOD HAMMER
customer_reviews.text: WELL BUILT. VERY LIGHT BUT VERY SOLID. HAS EASILY AND VERY EFFECTIVELY HANDLED EVERY PROJECT I HAVE USED IT FOR. VERY PLEASED WITH PURCHASE.
customer_reviews.author: Louis E. Delgado

customer_reviews.title: Best Value
customer_reviews.text: Can't beat this hammer for the price. Well made fiberglass handle, nice grip. For a home owner, and perhaps not the professional, I feel great about the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: T Shopper

customer_reviews.title: It's a nice light weight hammer and will serve fine for what ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice light weight hammer and will serve fine for what I use it for but would prefer a straight claw. Nice hammer though.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Rawstern

customer_reviews.title: It's a very small hammer
customer_reviews.text: This hammer is way too small...was going to send it back but my husband said what the hell tools cant be too much so I kept it
customer_reviews.author: tammy foster

customer_reviews.title: A good, light use hammer.
customer_reviews.text: A good, light-weight hammer for everyday use. Not what you'd use for building a house but for driving small nails for pictures and other small jobs, it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!!
customer_reviews.text: Great size for women and youth. Swings well and not too heavy! KUDOS Stanley!
customer_reviews.author: C.D.73

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: Love all my Stanley tools so far! Great, solid quality!
customer_reviews.author: Xenja Doyle

customer_reviews.title: Great around the house hammer.
customer_reviews.text: Great 7oz Stanley hammer. Perfect addition to a begginers tool set. Just a great all around house hammer.
customer_reviews.author: MissAshleyMariee

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Was a gift and looked very nice in box with other tools.
customer_reviews.author: Geraldine

customer_reviews.title: Light, strong and sturdy hammer.
customer_reviews.text: It's light and durable. Does its job, love the grip.
customer_reviews.author: Batzmaru

customer_reviews.title: Great light hammer
customer_reviews.text: Don't expect it to be your main hammer, but a go to hammer for easy jobs
customer_reviews.author: Gil Klempert

customer_reviews.title: Great picture hammer.
customer_reviews.text: Great hammer for picture hanging. I am a professional art installer and use this all the time. It is comfortable and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Dodge78

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and high quality portable tool box hammer
customer_reviews.text: You’re not going to frame a house with this hammer but it’s a high quality tool box hammer when you need one for unexpected light work. Some posters (obvious dullards that don’t know what 7 Oz means) complained it was a toy; it’s not. I ordered this one and a Great Neck at the same time. The GN is fine , but the Stanly is a far far more superior quality hammer and the best 7 Oz hammer I’ve ever seen on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Lex E. Anderson

product_meta.title: Stanley STHT51346 7Oz Curve Claw Fiberglass Hammer,
product_meta.description: The Stanley STHT51346 7Oz curve claw fiberglass hammer features a fiberglass handle which absorbs shock and vibration, with a slip resistant handle for a secure grip and comfort. It offers a superior head attachment for durability and long life, along with an overstrike protection plate that helps to prevent from damage. Designed as a nailing hammer, this tool offers a curved claw, with a smooth face and a fiberglass handle. Backed by Stanley limited lifetime warranty.
feature_bullets: Fiberglass handle absorbs shock and vibration
Slip resistant handle for secure grip and comfort
Superior head attachment for durability and long life
Overstrike protection plate helps to prevent from damage
